It was an honor to be selected by him to serve as United States Attorney and we will miss his wisdom dearly, but his legacy will endure for generations to come. Please join me in sending our deepest condolences to the Lugar family during this time of reflection and sadness.

But no matter the topic at hand, he always made time for the next generation, to teach and inspire young Hoosiers to serve their country, and to remind all of us that we have more in common as Americans than we do differences.

Senator Lugar worked brilliantly not only on security issues, but also on those that impacted Americans every day, including food security and global hunger, education for young people, energy independence and free trade.

He navigated foreign policy matters adeptly, leaving a safer world because of his work. He earned a Medal of Freedom for successfully convincing the former Soviet Union to dismantle their weapons at the end of the Cold War.
Senator Lugar was a veteran, Mayor of Indianapolis and the longest tenured Member of Congress to serve from Indiana who served Hoosiers with integrity and honor.
Today we lost a great man. Senator Richard Lugar dedicated his life to making the world a better and safer place.

Addressing substance abuse is a #bipartisan priority. Iâ€™m proud of the work weâ€™ve done, but given the continued escalation of the crisis, I remain committed to combatting the heroin & #opioidepidemic in Congress. @RxSummit

Last year, the SUPPORT for Patients & Communities Act was signed into law to help improve treatment & recovery for those struggling w/ #substanceabuse, preventing it before it begins, protecting our communities by better equipping law enforcement officers & fighting fentanyl.

We need these kinds of local efforts to support & actualize the work weâ€™re doing at the federal level. Because, while government can act in the form of legislation & funding, the people on the ground will determine how effective & efficient the day-to-day implementation is.

In 2014 when the task force started its work, more than 20% of patients at Marion General Hospital (MGH) â€“ one of the leaders of this task force - were prescribed opioids. In 2017, that number had fallen to 8.6% because MGH instituted new prescribing guidelines for #opioids.

This task force is a partnership of 30 different agencies that works to coordinate prevention, education, awareness, & treatment efforts for #Hoosiers. It works to address substance abuse throughout the community - in schools, juvenile courts, hospitals, prisons & more.

There is a group in #IN05 called the Grant County Substance Abuse Task Force that has been incredibly successful at reducing improper prescriptions at the local hospital, coordinating treatment options & care, & raising awareness in the community about drug abuse & prevention.

This brave #Hoosier was finally found &is being brought home after 76 years. Today, Private Fred Evert Freet was laid to rest &his family is able to get the closure they so rightfully deserve.

In 2015, new sets of human remains were recovered on the island in an undiscovered cemetery.  After intensive testing & investigating, the United States Navy positively identified one set of remains as Private Freet on August 6, 2018.

Several of our soldiers were buried on Betio Island & the United States Military recovered the remains of as many American casualties they could locate. Decades passed & there was still no sign of Private Freetâ€™s remains.

In 1943, Fred Evert Freet paid the ultimate sacrifice at the young age of 18, serving his country during WWII at the Battle of Tarawa on Betio Island. This honorable Marine was not officially declared killed in action &his remains deemed unrecoverable until 1949. pic.twitter.com/d9NBYeMatB

The #KeepingsGirlsinSchoolAct brings attention to the systemic barriers preventing girls from accessing secondary education, such as child marriage, religious or ethnic discrimination, female genital mutilation & poor safety traveling to schools >> https://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/bipartisan-bicameral-legislation-introduced-to-keep-girls-in-schoolÂ â€¦

While the U.S. has been the global leader in efforts to expand & improve educational opportunities, particularly for girls, there is still more work to be done to ensure access to quality education & expand girlsâ€™ economic futures.

Adolescent girls who remain in school are more likely to live longer, marry later & earn an income to support their families, thus helping the economic prosperity of their communities & nations. 

However, today +130 million girls worldwide are not in school.

If more girls were able to stay in school, we could reduce child death & child marriage rates, violent conflicts & poverty. I'm proud to join @RepLoisFrankel @RepBrianFitz & @NitaLowey to reintroduce #bipartisan legislation, the #KeepingsGirlsinSchoolAct. pic.twitter.com/gNvDoebwRJ
